content.description:
Start on a left hand undercling crimp and a good incut with the right at head level. Use footwork and crimp strength to move left to the obvious jug and top-out straight up.

 A potentially harder line could be done with a further left exit adding a few moves around the corner. 

 Would be surprised if this low hanging fruit hadn't been picked already. Feel free to update with FA info.
content.location: The obvious upside down pyramid on the river. Water starts to creep up during the warmer months.

content.description: Sit start matched in a large undercling. Reach out of the roof to some good edges & crimps, followed by some cool sidepulls as you pull up onto the balancey slab and top out.
content.location: from Tree Cave, walk downstream and downhill to the riverside boulders. This problem faces the river on the upstream of the two riverside boulders.

content.description: On the right side of the boulder, around the corner from Wayside and Typhoon. Start on a good RH gaston at face height and lower LH side pull, move out left, then dyno to the semi-sloper rail (very similar to the Beastmaker 2000 slopers)! A true outdoor comp climb. Just an FYI, the landing of this climb is usually under a few inches of water in the hotter months (occasionally gets lower in late spring, early fall). Prime time to hit this climb is the colder months (November through March)

Start sitting with the sharp jug pocket. Make a big move left to the lip and mantle to topout.

 It's useful to pile some of the old logs in the area in the water so that your pads don't get wet.
content.location: Around the corner to the left from The Pyramid Scheme on the same boulder.

content.description: Down the hill below the Project Boulder and on the river. This area goes underwater in the warmer months. Slick holds and dirty topouts but good lines.
